com.gwtplatform.dispatch.shared

Interface DispatchService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    RemoteService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDispatchServiceImpl, DispatchServiceImpl, DispatchServiceImpl
    Deprecated. 
    Please use DispatchService.

    @Deprecated
public interface DispatchService
extends RemoteService
    The base class of the synchronous dispatcher service. The server-side implementation is DispatchServiceImpl and the async client-side version is DispatchServiceAsync.

    This class is closely related to Dispatch, in theory the latter wouldn't be needed, but we use it to workaround a GWT limitation described in com.gwtplatform.dispatch.client.DispatchAsync.

    Author:
    Philippe Beaudoin
    See Also:
    com.gwtplatform.dispatch.client.DispatchAsync, Dispatch, DispatchImpl, DispatchService, DispatchServiceAsync, DispatchServiceImpl

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Result execute(String cookieSentByRPC, Action<?> action)
      Deprecated. 
      This method is called server-side whenever a new action is dispatched.
      void undo(String cookieSentByRPC, Action<Result> action, Result result)
      Deprecated. 
      This method is called server-side whenever a previously executed action needs to be undone.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        Result execute(String cookieSentByRPC,
             Action<?> action)
               throws ActionException,
                      ServiceException
        Deprecated. 
        This method is called server-side whenever a new action is dispatched.
        Parameters:
        cookieSentByRPC - This is the content of the security cookie accessed on the client (in javascript), its goal is to prevent XSRF attacks. See SecurityCookieAccessor for more details.
        action - The Action to execute.
        Returns:
        The Result of the action.
        Throws:
        ActionException - Thrown if the action could not be executed for application-specific reasons. User handlers should always throw ActionException or derived classes.
        ServiceException - Thrown if the action could not be executed because of a service error.
        See Also:
        DispatchServiceAsync.execute(java.lang.String, com.gwtplatform.dispatch.shared.Action<?>, com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback<com.gwtplatform.dispatch.shared.Result>)

      • undo

        void undo(String cookieSentByRPC,
        Action<Result> action,
        Result result)
          throws ActionException,
                 ServiceException
        Deprecated. 
        This method is called server-side whenever a previously executed action needs to be undone.
        Parameters:
        cookieSentByRPC - This is the content of the security cookie accessed on the client (in javascript), its goal is to prevent XSRF attacks. See SecurityCookieAccessor for more details.
        action - The Action to execute.
        result - The Result of this action when it was executed.
        Throws:
        ActionException - Thrown if the action could not be undone for application-specific reasons. User handlers should always throw ActionException or derived classes.
        ServiceException - Thrown if the action could not be undone because of a service error.
        See Also:
        DispatchServiceAsync.undo(java.lang.String, com.gwtplatform.dispatch.shared.Action<?>, com.gwtplatform.dispatch.shared.Result, com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback<java.lang.Void>)
